comments:
Tried to Add New Bugzilla report from the Task List before actually setting up
preferences, was given error. Went to preferences and set up what might be
reasonable Bugzilla parameters. Using a 2.18 install of bugzilla, entered the
front page url (http://[hostname]/bugzilla).  Now when accessing the task list I
get the error "Unable to get the products". Don't see any detailed messages in
log. Problem persists after restart of workbench.

Version: 3.1.1
Build id: M20050929-0840

Are you using a customized version of Bugzilla?  If so the current Bugzilla
support may not work with it, and you instead have to resort to using tasks with
web links.  Also, could you try to "Add an Existing Bugzilla Report" and let me
know if that works?

We customized some of the HTML on the front page, otherwise I'm not aware of any
changes...

Doing an add existing report works. I was also able to Add Bugzilla Query (was
initially thrown off by seeing Eclipse query parameters, but then found the
option to update parameters from our server).

Some bugzilla hardening and support for 2.20 is going out with tonight's 0.4.1
release.  Could I ask you to update next week and let me know what fails?  

That "update" option is too burried.
No problem, I'm setting a reminder.

Are you setting the reminder using Mylar? ;)

Fyi, a better reminder notification mechanism is in the works.  Right now it's
just a popup with a list but I think that the reminders should somehow be
visible in the task list itself.  It's nice to be able to set them on Bugzilla
reports.
Did you have a chance to try this again?

I am able to successfully do adds - but now get an SWT error after the bug is
added. logs show the following:

The Bugzilla support requires Eclipse's Browser integration, and this error is most likely
a result of not having Mozilla installed (which makes Eclipse's browsers fail, hance the
unknown MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME complaint).  Could you install if necessary, ensure that you
can use Eclipse's Internal Web Browser view, and try again?  In the meantime I've made
the error handling more informative.
I'm assuming that this was the Mozilla browser issue, since that's what caused this stack trace in the past.  0.4.3 has better error handling of it.  Please reopen if you see it again.

traces.message: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HO ME not set)]
